description:
The second season of Ansatsu Kyoushitsu.

The students return as school is back in session for the second semester. Following their exploits on the island during summer vacation, Class 3-E continues to sharpen their blades with their sights set on their teacher, the slippery Koro-sensei. They have more to worry about than just their teacher, however, as enemy assassins, both old and new, are out for the increased bounty on the octopus' head.

Moreover, their rivals in Class A, as well as Kunugigaoka Junior High's fearsome principal, stand to block Class E from achieving academic excellence. With all of these obstacles opposing them, the group must continue to work together in order to overcome their foes and accomplish their goal of successfully assassinating their teacher.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

name.native: イリーナ・イェラビッチ

alternative: Mr. Humiliated Failure in The First Semester

node.description: A manga artist known for creating Assassination Classroom and Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro. He was an assistant of Yoshio Sawai, the creator of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo (Neuro's Shirota Masakage made a cameo appearance in Shinsetsu Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo). He provided the voice of the mangaka in episode 25 of the Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naokisato_face) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1hlpldRj6GZ2naD4XDqi80)

Naoki Sato is a Japanese composer and producer who has provided the music for several popular anime series. He was born on May 2, 1970 and graduated in Chiba Prefecture and Tokyo College of Music. At the 29th Japanese Academy Awards in 2006, he won the Best Music prize for his work on the film Always Sanchōme no Yuhi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.
One of [Lerche](https://anilist.co/studio/456/)'s leading animators.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
Freelance sound effects creator.

__Awards:__ Best New Actor (2008), Best Supporting Actor (2011)
__Music:__
- Palette (1st Mini Album, released May 23, 2012)
- Enjoy☆Full (2nd Mini Album, released June 5, 2013)

) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/nobuhiko_okamoto/) | [Old Blog (Inactive)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/okamoto_teki_fukei/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ok_nobuhiko) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nobuhiko_cacao/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobuhiko_Okamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡本信彦)

Previously affiliated with the agency Pro-Fit. After the agency announced that they would be shutting down operation in 2022, he would be transferring to his own agency "Raccoon Dog", along with several other Pro-Fit talents.

[Website](http://www.ddl-ltd.co.jp/asanumashintarou.html) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/shintaro-asanuma/)

Shintarou Asanuma is a voice actor, dramatist, producer, copywriter, and designer. He was formerly affiliated with Office Osawa and is now part of Dandelion and is best known for voicing [Watashi](https://anilist.co/character/30579/) on [The Tatami Galaxy](https://anilist.co/anime/7785/), [Takatoshi Tsuda](https://anilist.co/character/32770/) on [Seitokai Yakuindomo](https://anilist.co/anime/8675/) and [Yousuke Kirie](https://anilist.co/character/2713/) on [Bokurano](https://anilist.co/anime/1690/).

A Japanese rock band signed to A-Sketch Music Label and has, as of 2015, released 4 EPs and multiple singles. In 2015, Frederic won the Kansai block local award at the 7th CD Shop Awards for their album "oddloop." This album was released on September 24, 2014 and was also their debut at a major record label.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/fabioreallyfast/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FabioCamposDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fabio.campos.3511)

Fábio Campos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director and musician.

As dubbing director, he has worked at DuBrasil since 2014, and is also a professor in the studio's dubbing course. He also works as a musician, being a bassist in the group Speed ​​Bullets Trio.

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Website](http://apphiayu.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/soymilkpudding)

Apphia Yu, also known as Ayu Sakata, is an American voice actress, director, and producer. She has worked on games such as Loren The Amazon Princess and Tales of Aravorn: Seasons of the Wolf, or for anime like Assassination Classroom. She is the founder of sakevisual, a company based in Dallas, Texas that makes original visual novel games. She is married to voice actor [Micah Solusod](https://anilist.co/staff/103686/).

(Source: Wikipedia)
